018package com.scivicslab.actoriac.cli;
019
020import java.io.BufferedReader;
021import java.io.File;
022import java.io.IOException;
023import java.io.InputStreamReader;
024import java.io.OutputStream;
025import java.net.InetSocketAddress;
026import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
027import java.sql.Connection;
028import java.sql.DriverManager;
029import java.sql.ResultSet;
030import java.sql.SQLException;
031import java.sql.Statement;
032import java.time.OffsetDateTime;
033import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
034import java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch;
035import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger;
036import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong;
037import java.util.logging.Logger;
038
039import com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange;
040import com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpServer;
041
042import org.h2.tools.Server;
043
044import com.scivicslab.actoriac.log.H2LogStore;
045
046/**
047 * Actor that wraps the H2 TCP server and HTTP info server.
048 *
049 * <p>This POJO actor manages the lifecycle of both servers and tracks
050 * connection activity for auto-shutdown functionality.</p>
051 *
052 * <p><strong>State Tracking:</strong></p>
053 * <ul>
054 *   <li>Tracks last activity time (session creation, log writes)</li>
055 *   <li>Tracks active connection count via TCP port inspection</li>
056 *   <li>Provides shutdown method for graceful termination</li>
057 * </ul>
058 *
059 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
060 * @since 2.11.0
061 */
062public class LogServerActor {
063
064    private static final Logger LOG = Logger.getLogger(LogServerActor.class.getName());
065
066    private final int tcpPort;
067    private final int httpPort;
068    private final File dbPath;
069    private final boolean verbose;
070
071    private Server tcpServer;
072    private HttpServer httpServer;
073    private OffsetDateTime startedAt;
074    private final AtomicLong lastActivityTime = new AtomicLong(System.currentTimeMillis());
075    private final AtomicInteger lastKnownSessionCount = new AtomicInteger(0);
076
077    private volatile boolean running = false;
078    private CountDownLatch shutdownLatch;
079
080    /**
081     * Creates a new LogServerActor.
082     *
083     * @param tcpPort H2 TCP port
084     * @param httpPort HTTP info API port
085     * @param dbPath database file path (without extension)
086     * @param verbose enable verbose logging
087     */
088    public LogServerActor(int tcpPort, int httpPort, File dbPath, boolean verbose) {
089        this.tcpPort = tcpPort;
090        this.httpPort = httpPort;
091        this.dbPath = dbPath;
092        this.verbose = verbose;
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Starts both TCP and HTTP servers.
097     *
098     * @param latch countdown latch to signal when server stops
099     * @throws Exception if server startup fails
100     */
101    public void start(CountDownLatch latch) throws Exception {
102        this.shutdownLatch = latch;
103        this.startedAt = OffsetDateTime.now();
104        this.lastActivityTime.set(System.currentTimeMillis());
105
106        // Start H2 TCP server
107        String[] serverArgs = new String[]{
108            "-tcp",
109            "-tcpPort", String.valueOf(tcpPort),
110            "-ifNotExists"
111        };
112        tcpServer = Server.createTcpServer(serverArgs);
113        tcpServer.start();
114
115        // Initialize database schema
116        initializeDatabase();
117
118        // Start HTTP info server
119        startHttpServer();
120
121        running = true;
122
123        if (verbose) {
124            LOG.info("LogServerActor started (TCP: " + tcpPort + ", HTTP: " + httpPort + ")");
125        }
126    }
127
128    /**
129     * Stops both servers gracefully.
130     */
131    public void stop() {
132        if (!running) {
133            return;
134        }
135
136        running = false;
137        LOG.info("LogServerActor stopping...");
138
139        if (httpServer != null) {
140            httpServer.stop(0);
141        }
142        if (tcpServer != null) {
143            tcpServer.stop();
144        }
145
146        if (shutdownLatch != null) {
147            shutdownLatch.countDown();
148        }
149
150        LOG.info("LogServerActor stopped.");
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Checks if the server is currently running.
155     */
156    public boolean isRunning() {
157        return running;
158    }
159
160    /**
161     * Gets the number of active TCP connections to this server.
162     * Uses netstat/ss to count established connections.
163     *
164     * @return number of active connections, or -1 if unable to determine
165     */
166    public int getActiveConnectionCount() {
167        try {
168            // Try ss first (faster on Linux)
169            ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder(
170                "ss", "-tn", "state", "established",
171                "sport", "=", ":" + tcpPort
172            );
173            pb.redirectErrorStream(true);
174            Process process = pb.start();
175
176            int count = 0;
177            try (BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(
178                    new InputStreamReader(process.getInputStream()))) {
179                String line;
180                while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
181                    // Skip header line and count established connections
182                    if (line.contains("ESTAB") || line.contains(":" + tcpPort)) {
183                        count++;
184                    }
185                }
186            }
187            process.waitFor();
188
189            // Subtract 1 for header line if present
190            return Math.max(0, count - 1);
191
192        } catch (Exception e) {
193            // Fallback: try netstat
194            try {
195                ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder(
196                    "netstat", "-tn"
197                );
198                pb.redirectErrorStream(true);
199                Process process = pb.start();
200
201                int count = 0;
202                try (BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(
203                        new InputStreamReader(process.getInputStream()))) {
204                    String line;
205                    while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
206                        if (line.contains(":" + tcpPort) && line.contains("ESTABLISHED")) {
207                            count++;
208                        }
209                    }
210                }
211                process.waitFor();
212                return count;
213
214            } catch (Exception e2) {
215                if (verbose) {
216                    LOG.warning("Unable to determine connection count: " + e2.getMessage());
217                }
218                return -1;
219            }
220        }
221    }
222
223    /**
224     * Gets the time since last activity in milliseconds.
225     */
226    public long getIdleTimeMillis() {
227        return System.currentTimeMillis() - lastActivityTime.get();
228    }
229
230    /**
231     * Records that activity occurred (called when sessions are created or logs written).
232     */
233    public void recordActivity() {
234        lastActivityTime.set(System.currentTimeMillis());
235    }
236
237    /**
238     * Checks if there has been any database activity since last check.
239     * Compares session count to detect new sessions.
240     *
241     * @return true if new sessions were created
242     */
243    public boolean checkForNewActivity() {
244        int currentCount = getSessionCount();
245        int lastCount = lastKnownSessionCount.getAndSet(currentCount);
246
247        if (currentCount > lastCount) {
248            recordActivity();
249            return true;
250        }
251        return false;
252    }
253
254    /**
255     * Gets the current session count from the database.
256     */
257    public int getSessionCount() {
258        String dbUrl = "jdbc:h2:tcp://localhost:" + tcpPort + "/" + dbPath.getAbsolutePath();
259        try (Connection conn = DriverManager.getConnection(dbUrl);
260             Statement stmt = conn.createStatement();
261             ResultSet rs = stmt.executeQuery("SELECT COUNT(*) FROM sessions")) {
262            if (rs.next()) {
263                return rs.getInt(1);
264            }
265        } catch (SQLException e) {
266            if (verbose) {
267                LOG.warning("Failed to get session count: " + e.getMessage());
268            }
269        }
270        return 0;
271    }
272
273    // ========== Server Info Getters ==========
274
275    public int getTcpPort() { return tcpPort; }
276    public int getHttpPort() { return httpPort; }
277    public File getDbPath() { return dbPath; }
278    public OffsetDateTime getStartedAt() { return startedAt; }
279
280    // ========== Private Helper Methods ==========
281
282    private void initializeDatabase() throws SQLException {
283        String dbUrl = "jdbc:h2:tcp://localhost:" + tcpPort + "/" + dbPath.getAbsolutePath();
284
285        try (Connection conn = DriverManager.getConnection(dbUrl);
286             Statement stmt = conn.createStatement()) {
287
288            H2LogStore.initSchema(conn);
289
290            // Get initial session count
291            try (ResultSet rs = stmt.executeQuery("SELECT COUNT(*) FROM sessions")) {
292                if (rs.next()) {
293                    lastKnownSessionCount.set(rs.getInt(1));
294                }
295            }
296
297            if (verbose) {
298                LOG.info("Database schema initialized: " + dbPath.getAbsolutePath());
299            }
300        }
301    }
302
303    private void startHttpServer() throws IOException {
304        httpServer = HttpServer.create(new InetSocketAddress("localhost", httpPort), 0);
305        httpServer.createContext("/info", this::handleInfoRequest);
306        httpServer.setExecutor(null);
307        httpServer.start();
308
309        if (verbose) {
310            LOG.info("HTTP info server started on port " + httpPort);
311        }
312    }
313
314    private void handleInfoRequest(HttpExchange exchange) throws IOException {
315        if (!"GET".equals(exchange.getRequestMethod())) {
316            exchange.sendResponseHeaders(405, -1);
317            return;
318        }
319
320        try {
321            int sessionCount = getSessionCount();
322            int connectionCount = getActiveConnectionCount();
323
324            String json = String.format("""
325                {
326                  "server": "actor-iac-log-server",
327                  "version": "2.11.0",
328                  "port": %d,
329                  "http_port": %d,
330                  "db_path": "%s",
331                  "db_file": "%s.mv.db",
332                  "started_at": "%s",
333                  "session_count": %d,
334                  "active_connections": %d,
335                  "idle_time_ms": %d
336                }
337                """,
338                tcpPort,
339                httpPort,
340                escapeJson(dbPath.getAbsolutePath()),
341                escapeJson(dbPath.getAbsolutePath()),
342                startedAt.format(DateTimeFormatter.ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME),
343                sessionCount,
344                connectionCount,
345                getIdleTimeMillis()
346            );
347
348            byte[] response = json.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
349            exchange.getResponseHeaders().add("Content-Type", "application/json");
350            exchange.sendResponseHeaders(200, response.length);
351            try (OutputStream os = exchange.getResponseBody()) {
352                os.write(response);
353            }
354        } catch (Exception e) {
355            String error = "{\"error\": \"" + escapeJson(e.getMessage()) + "\"}";
356            byte[] response = error.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
357            exchange.getResponseHeaders().add("Content-Type", "application/json");
358            exchange.sendResponseHeaders(500, response.length);
359            try (OutputStream os = exchange.getResponseBody()) {
360                os.write(response);
361            }
362        }
363    }
364
365    private String escapeJson(String value) {
366        if (value == null) return "";
367        return value
368            .replace("\\", "\\\\")
369            .replace("\"", "\\\"")
370            .replace("\n", "\\n")
371            .replace("\r", "\\r")
372            .replace("\t", "\\t");
373    }
374}
